abstract: Bosnian court sentences former soldiers Bosiljko Markovic and Ostoja Markovic to 10 years in prison and orders them to pay $15,160 to Croatian woman they raped during Serb attack on her village in 1992; trailblazing verdict paves way for legal practice adjustments that could bring war criminals to justice and compensate their victims in one trial.
lead_paragraph: The former soldiers were sentenced to 10 years in prison and ordered to pay $15,160 to a Croat woman they raped during the Serb attack on her village in 1992.

headline.main: Bosnia-Herzegovina: Court Grants Compensation to War Crimes Victim
headline.print_headline: Europe; Bosnia-Herzegovina: Court Grants Compensation to War Crimes Victim

snippet: The former soldiers were sentenced to 10 years in prison and ordered to pay $15,160 to a Croat woman they raped during the Serb attack on her village in 1992.

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
